title: How to Make an Indian Tuna Cutlet

steps.headline: Wash, chop and then boil the potatoes so they are soft enough to mash.
Open the cans of tuna and drain well.
steps.description: Your tuna may be in water or oil. Use a colander to drain very well. The cutlet mixture will be too loose if the tuna is wet. Drain the tuna while the potatoes are boiling.

steps.headline: Chop the required quantity of onion, curry leaves, and ginger into very small pieces.
Chop the green chili into very small pieces.
steps.description: You can also use chili powder if you do not have any green chilies.

steps.headline: Sauté the chopped ingredients in a frying pan with 1 tablespoon of oil.
steps.description: Mix continuously for about 2-3 minutes or until it is golden brown.

steps.headline: Skin and mash the potatoes in a large bowl.
steps.description: It doesn't have to be like mashed fully like mashed potatoes potatoes, just as long as it's not in its original form. You can mash the potatoes when you add the ingredients in the next step.

steps.headline: Add the sautéed ingredients and Garam masala into the potatoes.
Add the salt and tuna into the bowl.
Mix the ingredients until fully combined.
steps.description: If the mixture is loose, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of breadcrumbs and re-mix.

steps.headline: Take the eggs and beat very well in a small bowl.
Pour breadcrumbs on a plate.
steps.description: Pour enough to roll the cutlet in it.

steps.headline: Take a scoopful of mixture and roll it into a ball.
steps.description: Flatten it into an oval-shaped cutlet. You can shape the cutlet into any shape, but most people shape them into ovals. You can also do the flattening after you roll it in the breadcrumbs.

steps.headline: Take the oval-shaped (or ball-shaped) mixture and dip it in the egg.
Take the cutlet-dipped egg and roll in breadcrumb.
Repeat until you finish the mixture.
Place the deep fry pan on the stove and pour the rest of the oil (about 2 cups) into the pan.
steps.description: Wait for the oil to become hot.

steps.headline: Take a few breaded cutlets (around 4-5) and place them in the deep-fry pot.
Flip the cutlet after 2-3 minutes.
Fry the cutlet for about 5 minutes or until it turns medium brown in color.
Scoop out the cutlets with the ladle and place the cutlets on a plate.
steps.description: There should be a paper towel underneath the plate to soak up the excess oil.

steps.headline: Serve the hot cutlets.
steps.description: On another plate, serve the tuna cutlets with a side of ketchup. Slice tomatoes/cucumbers, if you want to have another snack on the side.

steps.headline: Enjoy!

Use a colander to drain very well. The cutlet mixture will be too loose if the tuna is wet. Drain the tuna while the potatoes are boiling. Chop the required quantity of onion, curry leaves, and ginger into very small pieces.  Chop the green chili into very small pieces. You can also use chili powder if you do not have any green chilies. Sauté the chopped ingredients in a frying pan with 1 tablespoon of oil. Mix continuously for about 2-3 minutes or until it is golden brown. Skin and mash the potatoes in a large bowl. It doesn't have to be like mashed fully like mashed potatoes potatoes, just as long as it's not in its original form. You can mash the potatoes when you add the ingredients in the next step. Add the sautéed ingredients and Garam masala into the potatoes.  Add the salt and tuna into the bowl.  Mix the ingredients until fully combined. If the mixture is loose, add 1 or 2 tablespoons of breadcrumbs and re-mix. Preparation Before Frying Take the eggs and beat very well in a small bowl.  Pour breadcrumbs on a plate. Pour enough to roll the cutlet in it. Take a scoopful of mixture and roll it into a ball. Flatten it into an oval-shaped cutlet. You can shape the cutlet into any shape, but most people shape them into ovals. You can also do the flattening after you roll it in the breadcrumbs. Take the oval-shaped (or ball-shaped) mixture and dip it in the egg.  Take the cutlet-dipped egg and roll in breadcrumb. Place on another plate. Repeat until you finish the mixture.  Frying and Serving Place the deep fry pan on the stove and pour the rest of the oil (about 2 cups) into the pan. Wait for the oil to become hot. Take a few breaded cutlets (around 4-5) and place them in the deep-fry pot.  Flip the cutlet after 2-3 minutes.  Fry the cutlet for about 5 minutes or until it turns medium brown in color.  Scoop out the cutlets with the ladle and place the cutlets on a plate. There should be a paper towel underneath the plate to soak up the excess oil. Serve the hot cutlets. On another plate, serve the tuna cutlets with a side of ketchup. Slice tomatoes/cucumbers, if you want to have another snack on the side. Enjoy!
